Title:
Molecular phylogeny and diversity of Laburnicola
(Didymosphaeriaceae): a new species from Uzbekistan
Keywords:
1 new species, coelomycetes, GIS mapping, multi-gene
taxonomy, saprobes, Pleosporales.
Abstract:
Laburnicola is a genus of Didymosphaeriaceae. The
Laburnicola species include saprobes and endophytes with a wide variety
of substrates. A collection in the subalpine region of Uzbekistan
discovered a new Laburnicola species on the dead stem of a wild rose in
terrestrial habitat. Maximum likelihood and Bayesian analyses of
combined LSU, SSU, ITS, and TEF dataset confirmed the new speciesâ€™
taxonomic position in Laburnicola. Our new species Laburnicola
zaaminensis (TASM 6152) was claded to L. dactylidis (MFLUCC 16-0285)
with (ML=90%, BYPP= 1.00). A detailed description with illustrations is
provided for the new species, Laburnicola zaaminensis. This is the first
report of Laburnicola from Central Asia. In addition, an annotated
species list, a geographic distribution map, and a diagnostic key to all
Laburnicola species are provided.
